election_record.label: New York 1819 State Senate, Western District

overview.note: Some sources spell Lyman Payne as "Lyman Paine."

sub_unit.name: Cayuga
sub_unit.note: The Official Canvass of Votes lists 1254 votes for Lyman Payne in Cayuga county, though the town votes in the original election returns add up to 1264.
Nathaniel Garrow received 20 votes as N. Garrow.
William Allen, Samuel Dill, John Haring, Rowland Day, John MacFadden, and David Brinkerhoff were candidates for State Assembly in Cayuga county.

sub_unit.name: Genoa
sub_unit.note: Gideon Granger received 20 votes as Gideon Grang.

sub_unit.name: Mentz
sub_unit.note: The Cayuga Republican (Auburn, NY) lists 46 votes for Lyman Payne in Mentz.

sub_unit.name: Cortland
sub_unit.note: Lyman Paine received 2 votes as L. Paine.
Gideon Granger received 2 votes as G. Granger.

sub_unit.name: Harrison
sub_unit.note: The Republican, May 6, reports 5 votes each for Gideon Granger and Lyman Payne.

sub_unit.name: Genesee
sub_unit.note: "Twenty towns yet to be heard from; and if Genessee gives less than 1000 majority for the Clintonians, then Swift and Garrow will be elected." The National Advocate (New York, NY). May 8, 1819.
Gerrit G. Lansing received 1 vote as Gerrit L. Lansing.

sub_unit.name: Brookfield
sub_unit.note: The Pilot, May 5 and 12, list no votes for Philetus Swift and Nathaniel Garrow in Brookfield.

sub_unit.name: Lenox
sub_unit.note: The Pilot, May 5 and 12, list 77 votes for Gerrit G. Lansing in Lenox.

sub_unit.name: Oneida
sub_unit.note: The Columbian Gazette, May 4, includes votes from Richland town in Oneida county. Richland town is in Oswego County.

sub_unit.name: Rome
sub_unit.note: The Gazette, May 4 and 11, report 13 votes for Lyman Paine in Rome.

sub_unit.name: Vernon
sub_unit.note: The Columbian Gazette, May 4, reports 65 votes for Charles Morrell in Vernon.

sub_unit.name: Onondaga
sub_unit.note: The Albany Argus (Albany, NY), May 18, reports 1170 votes for Lyman Payne, 1175 for Nathaniel Garrow, and 2 for Charles H. Morrell in Onondaga County.

sub_unit.name: Oswego
sub_unit.note: It appears that some returns in Oswego county were counted twice in the Official Canvass.
The Columbian Gazette, May 4, includes votes from Richland town in Oneida county. Richland town is in Oswego county.
The Columbian Gazette, May 11, reports 228 votes for Philetus Swift in Oswego county, though the town votes listed add up to 218.

sub_unit.name: Constantia
sub_unit.note: Gideon Granger received 1 vote as S. Gideon Granger.

sub_unit.name: Ovid
sub_unit.note: Charles H. Morrell received 1 vote as Cha. H. Morrell.

sub_unit.name: Romulus
sub_unit.note: Lyman Payne received 3 votes as Limon Pain.

sub_unit.name: Tioga
sub_unit.note: Gideon Granger received 1 vote listed among the scattering votes even though the name was spelled correctly.

sub_unit.name: Tompkins
sub_unit.note: "Landmarks of Tompkins County" lists 729 votes for Gideon Granger and 425 votes for Nathaniel Garrow in Tompkins county.

election_record.reference: Original Election Books. Steuben County Court House, Bath.
Orange County Patriot; or, the Spirit of Seventy-Six (Goshen, NY). April 13, 1819.
Utica Patriot, and Patrol (Utica, NY). May 4, 1819.
Utica Patriot, and Patrol (Utica, NY). May 11, 1819.
Selkreg, John H., ed. Landmarks of Tompkins County New York. Syracuse, NY: D. Mason and, 1894. 29.
History of Allegany County, N. Y. New York: F.W. Beers and, 1879. 238.
